result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Dewann Pettis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Elderly, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs/DNA surcharge.
Pay al costs, assessments and victim witness surcharge.  Bail to apply.
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Court advised defendant as a convicted felon he may not carry or  possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Dewann Pettis

records.addlTxt: Bail refund check packet
Original Transcript OF SENTENCING (15 pages) commencing APRIL 25, 2016 received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Dewann Pettis in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Marcus Dewann Pettis in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  There have been no restitution requests and restitution is set at ZERO.  Statements made to the court.
AS to count 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 32 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 117 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 16 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 16 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Defendant remanded.
JusticePoint DISCHARGE SUMMARY received and filed.  Defendant has new charges, 16CF1044.

Defendant Marcus Dewann Pettis in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea hearing.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court order Count 1 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Count 2.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights, addendum to plea questionnaire, and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  

The Court orders the defendant REMANDED.  Defense bail motion heard and denied.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Marcus Dewann Pettis not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is requesting that the court reinstate the previously forfeited $750.00 cash bail on this case (3-9-2016) as the defendant was in custody(new charge 16CF1044).  The court will order the prior bail reinstated and will vacate the order for the $1000.00 cash bail.  Case is adjourned to 3-29-2016 for plea/sentencing.

Defendant Marcus Dewann Pettis in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is now out of custody and the speedy trial demand is moot for trial on 3-9-2016.
The court has reviewed all submissions by counsels and finds that the statement was an excited utterance and meets the requirements of the 3 prong test and will allow the admission of the statement.  
Defense will advise the court if the case will resolve short of trial

Defendant Marcus Dewann Pettis in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Marcus Dewann Pettis in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court is informed that the medical records which the state will move to introduce have not been received as of today's date.  Upon review of submissions by counsels that court finds statement is relevant, an excited utterance.  Defense counsel will submit police reports for the court to review prior to the next date.
The court will adjourn the trial date, but deems the defendant's speedy trial demand waived as to today's date.  
Speedy trial demand is re-entered effective today's date.    Case set for final pretrial on 2-22-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 3-9-2016 at 8:15am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.
